Package com.atakmap.android.maps

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.atakmap.map.AtakMapView
          • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
    public class MapView
extends AtakMapView
    The content view for a MapActivity

    Responsible for dispatched MapEvents:

    • MapEvent.MAP_MOVED when the position, zoom, or focus changes

      • getDeviceCallsign

        public java.lang.String getDeviceCallsign()
        Retrieves the device callsign. This may be different than the callsign stored in shared preferences if the device is making use of the wave relay callsign that is being passed to it via callsign mocking. Callsign mocking is considered to be temporary and when the callsign is no longer being mocked, the device will revert back to the callsign set in shared preferences. If you would like to know the shared preference version of the callsign, please use the key "locationCallsign" to query the saved preference value.
        Returns:
        the current callsign based on a combination of the shared preference and the validity of the mocking state.

      • getDeviceUid

        public static java.lang.String getDeviceUid()
        Returns the device uid which is exactly the same as the self markers uid.

      • setDeviceCallsign

        public void setDeviceCallsign​(java.lang.String callsign)
        Used to set the transient value of the device callsign and does not effect the default user callsign between system restarts. To change the device callsign please make use of the shared preference key "locationCallsign".
        Parameters:
        callsign - the transient state of the device callsign which does not persist.

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.1",
               forRemoval=false)
public GeoPointMetaData inverseWithElevation​(float x,
                                             float y)
        Deprecated.
        See MapRenderer2.inverse(PointD, GeoPoint, MapRenderer2.InverseMode, int, MapRenderer2.DisplayOrigin) and ElevationManager.getElevation(double, double, ElevationManager.QueryParameters, GeoPointMetaData)
        Computes the corresponding geodetic coordinate for the specified screen coordinate with the addition of looking up the elevation data.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value for the screen coordinate
        y - the y value for the screen coordinate
        Returns:
        the corresponding geopoint for a given screen location, null if there is no corresponding point.

        public double getMinMapTilt​(double mapScale)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getMaxMapTilt

        public double getMaxMapTilt​(double mapScale)
        Returns the maximum allowed tilt level for the system at a specific map scale.
        Returns:
        a double representing the maximum tilt for the current scale value not exceeding the current maximum tilt for the system.

      • updateView

        public void updateView​(double latitude,
                       double longitude,
                       double scale,
                       double rotation,
                       double tilt,
                       boolean animate)
        Description copied from class: AtakMapView
        Call to update the view provided a latitude, longitude, scale, rotation, tilt and a flag for animation.
        Overrides:
        updateView in class AtakMapView
        Parameters:
        latitude - the latitude in decimal degrees
        longitude - the longitude in decimal degrees
        scale - a number between getMinMapScale() and getMaxMapScale()
        tilt - a number between 0 (nadir) and 89
        animate - if the resulting update should animate (fly) to the new location
